name: Homemade waffles with cherries
description: Bursting with juicy cherries and boasting a delicate texture, these waffles are a delightful fusion of sweet and satisfying.
author: Jenny Lemon
ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh cherries, pitted and chopped
method: Preheat your waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat the egg, then stir in the milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Don't overmix; it's okay if there are a few lumps.
Gently fold in the chopped cherries.
Once the waffle iron is heated, lightly grease it with cooking spray or melted butter.
Pour enough batter onto the hot waffle iron to cover the waffle grid. Close the lid and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions, usually until golden brown and crispy.
Carefully remove the waffle and repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve the cherry waffles warm with your favorite toppings, such as maple syrup, whipped cream, or additional fresh cherries.

name: American pancakes with cherry sauce
description: Indulge in the perfect harmony of fluffy American pancakes with cherry sauce.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: Make the cherry sauce: In a saucepan, combine cherries, sugar, lemon juice, and water. Cook until cherries soften. Mix cornstarch with water and add to saucepan. Cook until thickened. Stir in vanilla extract and set aside.
Prepare the pancake batter: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla. Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Cook the pancakes: Heat a skillet, grease with butter or oil. Pour batter onto skillet. Cook until bubbles form on surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve pancakes warm with cherry sauce drizzled on top. Enjoy!

name: Pomegranate and pistachio granola bowl
description: Savor the delightful blend of crunchy oats, nutty pistachios, and juicy pomegranate arils in this irresistible granola bowl.
author: Jenny Lemon
ingredients: Greek yogurt or plant-based yogurt, for serving
method: Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped pistachios, honey or maple syrup, melted coconut oil, ground cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. Stir until everything is well coated.
Spread the granola mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until the granola is golden brown and crisp.
Remove the granola from the oven and let it cool completely.
Once cooled, transfer the granola to a bowl and top with pomegranate arils.
Serve the granola bowl with Greek yogurt or your favorite plant-based yogurt.

name: Butternut squash soup with toasted seeds
description: Indulge in the comforting warmth and rich flavors of butternut squash soup, with a delightful crunch from toasted seeds.
author: Jenny Lemon
ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and diced
method: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the diced butternut squash to the pot along with the ground cumin and ground coriander. Stir to coat the squash with the spices.
Pour in the vegetable broth, then bring the mixture to a simmer. Cover the pot and let it cook until the butternut squash is tender, about 20-25 minutes.

While the soup is cooking, heat a dry skillet over medium heat. Add the pumpkin seeds and sunflower seeds to the skillet and toast them, stirring frequently, until they are golden brown and fragrant, about 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

Once the butternut squash is tender, use an immersion blender to purée the soup until smooth. Alternatively, transfer the soup in batches to a blender and purée until smooth, then return it to the pot.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste, adjusting the seasoning as needed.
Ladle the soup into bowls and sprinkle the toasted seeds over the top.
Serve the butternut squash soup hot, garnished with additional toasted seeds if desired.

name: Strawberry and mint salad with walnuts
description: Experience the vibrant medley of sweet strawberries, fresh mint, and crunchy walnuts in this refreshing and satisfying salad.
author: Jenny Lemon
ingredients: 2 cups fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
method: In a bowl, combine the sliced strawberries, chopped mint leaves, and walnuts.
Drizzle the honey and balsamic vinegar over the strawberry mixture.
Gently toss the salad until all the ingredients are evenly coated.
Season with a pinch of salt to enhance the flavors.
Serve immediately as a refreshing side dish or light dessert.

name: Vegetable balti with homemade naan breads
description: Savor the aromatic blend of tender vegetables in a fragrant balti sauce, served alongside warm homemade naan breads.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and ginger. Cook until onions are soft and translucent.
Add bell pepper, cauliflower, broccoli, and carrot to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are slightly tender.
Stir in diced tomatoes and balti paste. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for another 10-15 minutes until vegetables are cooked through and sauce has thickened.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Easy chicken and bacon pasta
description: Delight in a simple yet indulgent dish of tender chicken, crispy bacon, and al dente pasta tossed in a creamy Parmesan sauce.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside, reserving some pasta water.
In a large skillet, cook the chopped bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon from the skillet and set aside, leaving the bacon fat in the skillet.

Season diced chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In the same skillet with the bacon fat, cook the chicken until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add halved cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Pour in the heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Stir until the sauce is smooth and creamy. If the sauce is too thick, you can thin it out with a splash of reserved pasta water.
Add the cooked pasta and crispy bacon to the skillet. Toss everything together until the pasta is well coated in the creamy sauce.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste, if needed.
Serve the chicken and bacon pasta hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

name: Refreshing pomegranate and lemon juice
description: Experience the invigorating burst of tangy lemon and sweet pomegranate in this refreshing juice.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: In a blender, combine the pomegranate seeds, lemon juice, honey or agave syrup, and cold water.
Blend until smooth and well combined.
Strain the juice through a fine mesh sieve to remove any pulp or seeds.
Pour the juice into glasses filled with ice cubes, if desired.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves for an extra burst of flavor and presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing taste of pomegranate and lemon juice!

name: Lemon and poppyseed drizzle cake
description: Delight in the zesty tang of lemon paired with the subtle crunch of poppy seeds in this irresistible drizzle cake.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
In a bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, lemon zest, and poppy seeds. Set aside.
In a separate large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Stir in the lemon juice and vanilla extract.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with the buttermilk, and mixing until just combined. Be careful not to overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
While the cake is baking, prepare the glaze by whisking together the powdered sugar and lemon juice until smooth. Adjust the consistency by adding more lemon juice if needed.
Once the cake is done, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
Transfer the cake to a wire rack set over a baking sheet. Pour the glaze over the warm cake, allowing it to drizzle down the sides.

name: Garden pea soup with fresh mint
description: Indulge in the vibrant flavors of garden pea soup infused with fresh mint, offering a refreshing and comforting experience in every spoonful.
author: Jenny Lemon
ingredients: 2 cups frozen or fresh garden peas
Optional: Greek yogurt or cream for garnish
method: In a pot, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, sautéing until softened and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the garden peas to the pot and sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable or chicken broth, then bring the mixture to a simmer. Let it cook for about 10 minutes until the peas are tender.
Remove the pot from heat and stir in the chopped fresh mint leaves.
Using an immersion blender or regular blender, blend the soup until smooth and creamy.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.

name: American banana and honey pancakes
description: Indulge in the comforting blend of ripe bananas and sweet honey infused into fluffy American pancakes.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, mix together the mashed banana, egg, milk, melted butter, and honey until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix; it's okay if the batter is slightly lumpy.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake and the edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip the pancakes and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Transfer the cooked pancakes to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm while you cook the remaining pancakes.

name: Avocado, tomato and feta salad
description: Savor the harmonious blend of creamy avocado, juicy tomatoes, and tangy feta cheese, dressed with a light vinaigrette.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced avocados, tomatoes, and crumbled feta cheese.
Drizzle the extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar over the salad ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Gently toss the salad until all ingredients are well coated with the dressing.
Transfer the salad to a serving dish.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves, if desired.
Serve immediately as a refreshing side dish or light meal.

name: Blueberry and vanilla cheesecake
description: Indulge in a lusciously creamy cheesecake infused with the sweet tang of blueberries and the aromatic essence of vanilla.
author: Jenny Lemon
method: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9-inch springform pan.
In a mixing bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan.
In a separate bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract. Gently fold in 1 cup of fresh blueberries.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the crust in the pan. Smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until the center is set.
Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool completely.

While the cheesecake is cooling, prepare the blueberry topping. In a saucepan, combine 1 cup of fresh blueberries, sugar, and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat until the blueberries burst and release their juices.
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with water until smooth. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the blueberry mixture. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Let the blueberry topping cool slightly, then pour it over the cooled cheesecake.
Chill the cheesecake in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, or until firm.
Once chilled, remove the cheesecake from the springform pan and slice.
